intro: Fumana paphlagonica, commonly known as the Paphlagonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
